entry.title: Combined summary - Purely off-chain coin colouring
entry.summary: The email thread on the Bitcoin-dev mailing list discusses various aspects of non-fungible tokens (NFTs) and their impact on the blockchain network. One of the main concerns raised is the difficulty of ordering transactions in blocks due to the non-fungibility of NFTs. However, a proposed solution involves writing a patch to the "ord" tool and creating a new message to address this issue.The discussion also explores the concept of single-use seals for tracking assets anchored to Bitcoin. Examples such as the RGB Protocol Project and Taro are mentioned as implementations of this idea. The idea is to keep application data off-chain while committing to a UTXO and using Bitcoin as a proof-of-publication system, which can make transactions cheaper and more scalable. Several ongoing implementations of this concept are mentioned.Furthermore, the conversation delves into the use of ordinals to track individual satoshis throughout their lifetime. While a proposed BIP lacks documentation on associating data or rights with an ordinal, the "ord" tool fills this gap with its inscriptions feature. It is suggested that inscriptions could be moved entirely off-chain, allowing ownership transfers to occur on-chain while keeping inscription data private.Another topic discussed is semi-fungible tokens, which are compared to stable coins. Unlike stable coins that have a fixed value, semi-fungible tokens, such as those used in Liquid's multi-asset model, fluctuate in value based on changes in the price of Bitcoin. This model offers advantages over NFTs.Additionally, the email touches on the subject of off-chain colouring, which refers to the creation of unwanted NFTs assigned to existing satoshis in a wallet. This poses challenges when it comes to discarding unwanted NFTs without affecting desired ones. Despite efforts to prevent such situations, coloured bitcoins remain largely unavoidable and must be dealt with rather than avoided.In conclusion, the email provides insights into the possibilities and limitations of NFTs, compares them to Liquid's multi-asset model for semi-fungible tokens, and suggests approaches for addressing challenges related to NFTs and off-chain colouring. It also includes links to various projects related to Bitcoin and NFT systems.
